intro: Oreamunoa, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers have five petals and a prominent central stigma. Oreamunoa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
